info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 08 at 12:33PM EDT until June 08 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 100 PM EDT FOR SOUTHERN CHARLES CITY...PRINCE GEORGE...NORTH CENTRAL SUSSEX AND NORTHWESTERN SURRY COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF HOPEWELL... At 1233 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Jordans Point to near Disputanta to 7 miles east of Carson, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. These severe storms will be near... Burrowsville around 1255 PM EDT. Waverly, Cabin Point and Rustic around 105 PM EDT. Claremont around 110 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include New Bohemia, Taylors Corner, Newville, Birchett Estate, Prince George Golf, Brandon, Oak Hill Corner, Jordan Point Country Club and Barham. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
